page.title: 15LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: {Mr. William Waldorf Astor}and was given to his son, {Waldorf Astor (2nd {Viscount Astor)}in 1906. {Waldorf} married {Nancy Langhorne,}who was to become the first ever woman M.P. { {Cliveden}was given to the {National {Trust}in 1942. The grounds are open to the public, but the house is being renovated, to be opened in 1986 as an hotel. During the 1st World War the tennis court and the bowling alley next to Taplow Lodge were adapted by the{ {Canadian Army Red Cross}to a military hospital, treating over 24,000 casualties. The hospital was adopted by the{National Health}as a general hospital and was renowned for it's care of arthritic children and as a maternity unit. In early 1985 the hospital closed down and the buildings are being used as a feature film 'set'
